header.title: Primark fire blamed on ‘God’s Wrath’ over support for Gay Pride
header.postText: Religious fundamentalists have blamed the Belfast Primark fire that destroyed a 233-year-old building on ‘God’s Wrath’ because the store had a window display in support of Gay Pride.', 'It is not yet known how the fire started in the historic Bank Building in Belfast’s city centre that saw the five-storey structure almost entirely destroyed.', 'But a small number of people on Twitter seem to think support for Pride is to blame, with one quoting the Bible alongside a photo of the rainbow-coloured display, saying ‘you reap what you sow’.', 'In a now-deleted tweet, Jonathon Eccles wrote: ‘Primark Belfast up in flames.', '‘Galatians 6:& comes to mind… ‘Be not deceived: God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.’', 'Another person tweeted: ‘@Primark supported wickedness via it’s shop window a few weeks ago in Belfast.’', 'William Brown wrote on Facebook: ‘The Almighty God has showed his wrath on Primark store in Belfast which was found ablaze this morning for supporting Gay Pride.', '‘Be not deceived, God is not mocked.’', 'He then added: ‘FOR GOD AND ULSTER.’', 'A fourth said: ‘Reminds me of our Trinitarian God who burnt not just a shop, but a whole city to a crisp.’', '', 'Earlier this month, on August 4, thousands of people took to the streets in Belfast to celebrate the city’s 25th annual Pride parade – marching past the iconic Primark building and its LGBT+ window display.', 'The Northern Ireland Humanists group called out the homophobic comments online.', '‘This is because Primark had created a rainbow window presentation in support of Pride Belfast this year.', '‘We know this is not the feelings of most Christians, but we would ask you, religious or not, to call out this homophobic rhetoric where you find it.', '‘We hope those employed by Primark are being helped while out of work. And we also hope the building will be rebuilt as it is one of Belfast’s most beautiful.’', 'On Tuesday 80 fire fighters and 14 vehicles fought to tackle the blaze, clothing nearby offices and seeing shoppers and residents evacuated from the city centre.', 'A 45-metre exclusion zone still remains in place around the building, as fire officers have warned the burnt-out shell could collapse.', 'The store had been undergoing a multi-million pound refurbishment prior to the fire, but the Northern Ireland Fire and Rescue Service (NIFRS) were able to stop it from spreading to the new part.', 'NIFRS area commander Aidan Jennings said that structural engineers are working on the scene to establish whether the facade of the building can be saved.', '‘There is still a risk it could collapse and that’s why we have the cordons in place,’ he said.', '‘At the facade of the building you can see the structural damage and the collapsed and twisted steel but we can’t access that area because of risk of it collapsing.’
